name: Supply chain specialist with Oil & Gas
description:
The position involves managing all aspects of crude and petroleum product and dry bulk shipments and providing support to traders as required.

Requirements:

  • A Bachelor’s degree in the following Shipping/Marine Engineering/Petroleum or Chemical Engineering/Commerce/Logistics is preferable but not critical with the right experience. A Master’s degree is a plus.
  • Continuous track record with a shipping line or a trading company in a supply chain management role.
  • A good communicator with excellent business English and Russian.
  • Meticulousness, diligence, an eye for detail is essential.

Responsibilities:

  • Working closely with the trading team to execute and support physical trading activity.
  • Implementing effective cargo assurance procedures, providing assurance on quality and quantity issues, investigating and resolving quality/quantity/demurrage claims and disputes effectively.
  • Managing relationship with inspection, transport and forwarding companies to ensure compliance with company's expectations/requirements related to policies, procedures, billing rates and performance.
  • Submitting/reviewing operational claims in a timely manner and actively seeking ways to minimize delays and operational costs.
  • Working continuously on the ways of streamlining and optimizing the existing supply chains and providing a constructive input into the design of cost efficient business processes.
  • Gathering, scanning, filtering and analyzing market intelligence on ongoing business flows, shipping dynamics and directions, import-export patterns and fluctuations to existing business models with a view to provide an insightful business solutions consistent with the company’s wider strategy.
  • Handling the planning and shipping execution for marine and inland shipments of oil/oil products and diligent implementation of post-fixture operations. Providing cover and support to other benches and wider operations as and when required.
  • Providing for and controlling the timely issuance of proper shipping documents, and giving documentary and operational instructions to suppliers, forwarders, transport and other service providing companies.
  • Bookkeeping transactions and invoicing as per contractual terms and record keeping of all the details for internal reporting purposes.
  • Checking data input entry of physical contracts onto internal record keeping systems. Ensuring accurate, complete, consistent and timely data capture.

Conditions:

  • Work in a multinational international company.
  • Office location is in Moscow-City.
  • Competitive salary (depends on experience and qualification).
  • Medical and travel insurance, mobile phone allowance.

The member of the team is expected to be proactive, to provide constructive input in streamlining and optimising supply chains, to monitor the markets and trade flows for generation of better supply chain management solutions.
